title: Auto regenerating "Recovered Messages" folder
content: Why does Thunderbird keep auto re-generating a "Recovered Messages" folder on a message that I sent days ago? Can I turn off this "feature"?
creator: benjamin.kurata

title: How to create a mailing list?
content:
How do I set up a mailing list in this latest version of Thunderbird? In the past I was able to group people in my address book into various groups and then mass mail to a given group (mailing list).

I recently bought a new computer w/ Windows 11, installed Thunderbird just fine; but, I am unable to establish my previous groups/mailing lists.

Does anyone know of a way to doe this? I have looked at the help section on this, but its help advice is dated 2015 and applies to a much older version of Thunderbird. There is no "Address book > new> mailing group" option in this latest version of the program that I can find.
creator: gneiss2

title: Can't receive or send e-mails
content:
URGENT HELP NEEDED Since yesterday morning(5th Feb) I have been unable to send or receive e-mails. When sending I get the following message: "Sending of the message failed. Peer's Certificate has been revoked. The Configuration related to must be corrected."

A pop- up also started to ask for my password.

Why is this all of a sudden happening and how can it be fixed?

Regards Colin Henderson
creator: cldownunder

title: unable to send emails. error popping up
content:
I have connected Microsoft emails but unable to send them. error popping up

need help to set up Microsoft high volume email as well . all error popping up and cannot send emails. need help please
creator: manjula.brenda

title: Rollback from 135.0 to 128.7.0
content:
Hi,

I need to roll back from Thunderbird 135.0 (Release Channel) to 128.7.0 (Extended Support Release) without losing any data. However, I am receiving a message about creating a new profile due to compatibility reasons.

I would like to downgrade while maintaining a seamless experience, ideally with just a few clicks. This Thunderbird e-mail client is used in an operational environment. Could you guide me on how to do this?

Alternatively, is there a way to get my add-ons working again on version 135.0?

I also find Thunderbirdâ€™s handling of add-ons across different versions quite frustrating. The frequent compatibility issues between versions create unnecessary problems. Is there any plan to make this process more flexible in the future?

Thanks in advance for your help!
creator: fred.stiens.online
